title: The Cry of a Hungry Baby
description: Bob Odenkirk and David Cross lead an ensemble cast that performs an anything-goes montage of offbeat, off-kilter sketches brimming with edge and energy.

title: What to Think
description: Bob Odenkirk and David Cross lead an ensemble cast that performs an anything-goes montage of offbeat, off-kilter sketches brimming with edge and energy.

title: We Regret to Inform You
description: David becomes a third wheel, Bob gets a mail order bride.

title: Who Let You In?
description: When a high-speed pursuit involving the Popemobile breaks out, Bob gives expert advice. Spank, a performance artist tries to leave his mark on the American flag.

title: Now, Who Wants Ice Cream?
description: Mr. Show becomes a sovereign nation and has a stand-off with the FBI. Bob hosts the 8 and 1 Super pan infomercial. David tries to smuggle pot through customs.

title: A Talking Junkie
description: Bob Odenkirk and David Cross lead an ensemble cast that performs an anything-goes montage of offbeat, off-kilter sketches brimming with edge and energy.

title: The Biggest Failure in Broadway History
description: Mr. Show presents Jeepers Creepers - Semi Star: The Musical (aka The Biggest Failure In Broadway History), David takes a look at the friendlier side of the KKK, and Mr. Show presents the American Ad Awards.

roles.char: Grand Wizard of the New KKK

title: Heaven's Chimney
description: The Mr. Show cult prepares to take viewers up Heaven's Chimney. David gets deprogrammed as a follower. Bob survives "The Devastator". Plus an inside look at the Hail Satan Network.

title: Oh, You Men
description: Bob and David seek an audience with the mayor of television.

title: Flat Top Tony and the Purple Canoes
description: The lost episode of Mr. Show is being taped. Bob takes a lie detector. David takes a trip through Drugachusettes. Bob gets kicked out of an all-handicapped band when they think he is a horrible drummer.

title: Please Don't Kill Me
description: Bob and David find creative ways to raise money for charitable concerns. Mr. Show hosts the annual Dr. X telethon.
